episode_summary: This episode covers a range of quirky and historical facts, including a mishap at the Large Hadron Collider, the unusual medical treatment of President James Garfield, peculiar baby names in the US, and the discovery of historical bones in unexpected places.

facts.fact: The Large Hadron Collider was almost turned off because they found a piece of baguette in the machinery, which made the temperature go up by seven degrees.
For the last month of his life, US President James Garfield ate everything through his anus.
In 2013, six people in the US named their child Mushroom.
Historians were excited about the potential discovery of Alfred the Great's bones, but it turned out to be just a pelvis bone, and they are not sure if it is his.
